abstract_summ: Black respondents reported significantly more anxiety, whereas respondents without children living at home reported less anxiety.Using a sample of adults from the United States (n = 513), the present study examined demographic and individual correlates of anxiety about financial hardship on March 17th, 2020, the day after historic stock market drops in response to the emerging COVID-19 crisis.Younger adults tended to report greater anxiety than older adults.The questionnaire consisted of questions on home blood glucose monitoring, regularity in doing their physical activity and dietary compliance and anxiety about the viral infection.Low collective self-esteem, low conscientiousness, and low openness to experience were associated with greater economic anxiety.
